who stays dry under his little umbrella!

Born of steel, confined in a throat of walls.
I speak only in numbers and stop when called.
Seek me at the root of the realm where degrees multiply.
Guess your next location

Between two buzzing hives, I lie flat yet stand tall.
My face changes with seasons,
My voice is written, not heard.
Find me where news meets noon breaks.
Where the sweat meets the sip
No more scanning, no need to pause - just walk through the booth without a cause.
The E stands tall with knowledge bright, opposite rests a sign of insight with rainbow colours.
Where rubber rests and carbonation whispers, Time idles on crowded perches. A silent sentinel quenches none, While crimson reigns in the chamber of chill.
Who said, "Education is not the learning of facts, but the training of the mind to think"?

Born of silence, I swallow the sky's tears.
Voices converge where my shadow lies.
The watcher of hues guards my secret face ‚ÄîSeek the threshold where air and earth conspire.

Far from the hill yet close to His gaze,I dwell where echoes of faith amaze.
Noven watchful visages guard my art,
Seek where silence etches what shades impart.
Guess the Next Place??

I stand before the giant that speaks in light,
Where crowds drift past from morn to night.
My face changes with each new tale ‚ÄîSeek the watcher that never fails.

Where colors tempt yet hands must yield,
By metal steeds and gamesmen's field.
A silent sentinel guards the bloom ‚Äî
Find where beauty forbids its own perfume.

I feed the weary with a lifeless flame,
No pulse, no breath ‚Äî yet I restore the same.
Silent I stand where rotation come to revive,
Seek the source where motion regains its drive.

Look for a calm stone blessed by moonlight,
A serpent guards it - yet it bites none.

If you were to find this wall, you'd see no beggars, no sellers, no gates ‚Äî
 only hooks, hangers, and handwritten notes that read:
 "Take what you need. Leave what you can."
What is this wall called

‚ÄúThe highest education is that which does not merely give us Information but makes our life In harmony with all existence.‚Äù

Find the person by whom these lines were said.

Every face here is a step up the ladder -
Find the wall that made the campus prouder.

Her words are scrambled on the wall‚Ä¶
    "'IDEAS ABOUT CURIOUS MORE AND PEOPLE ABOUT CURIOUS LESS BE.'"

Which spot in our college was once the 
gatekeeper of fevers?

I rise and fall without a sigh, in a 
place where scholars fly. What am I?

If you don‚Äôt look, you‚Äôll pass me by,
A hidden path where few rely.
Not the grand but the subtle way,
A lesser road near D Block lay.
What am I?

Find me where my roots grow strong, 
much like Attarintiki Daredi‚Äôs story‚Äîforever long!

A podium stands in a square so neat 
where students and teachers often meet? Where am I?

I‚Äôm a place where water dances high, 
Near books and pens that you buy. 
Close to the stationery, I gleam and shine, 
What am I? Take your time!

Act I: The Beginning.
Scene I: A mysterious place.

[Enter W, D]
W: Am I a number?
D: If so, let us proceed.

Act II: The Water Dispenser.
Scene I: A mysterious place.

[Enter T, E]
T: Speak, I beg thee, of 87, 97, 116, 101, 114.
E: Speak, I beg thee, of 32, 68, 105, 115, 112, 101, 110, 115, 101, 114.

Act III: The Ground.

[Enter G, R]

R: Speak, I beg thee, of 32.

[Exeunt]

I stand tall with a wooden face, 
in this college, find my place!

Where students rush not for food, 
but for lab records and last-minute prints.
Who was the discoverer of gravity before Isaac Newton?

I am where young minds play with circuits and code,
A high-tech haven where hands-on skills are bestowed.
Under a mission that sparks India's innovative art,
I nurture STEM dreams right from the start.
What am I?
Find the place that becomes an ocean during the rainy season, where water rises and cascades. Then, head towards the venue where the legend Kobe Bryant showcased his skills and left his mark.

A leap of belief, a boundless stride,
Find the road where fear must hide.
Tread where devotion leaves its mark, a path of faith both bright and stark.
With strength untamed and heart so true, whose footsteps guide the way for you?

remover of obstacles, shining bright.

one representing learners and the

within the halls where postgraduates are found.
